skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: OFFICIAL skill from Anthropic containing only documentation and brand guidelines. No executable code, external dependencies, or security concerns detected.

content.value_statement: Automatically apply Anthropic's official brand colors, typography, and visual identity to your presentations, documents, and design artifacts for a professional, on-brand appearance.
actual_capabilities: Apply Anthropic's official color palette (Dark, Light, Orange, Blue, Green) to artifacts
Use Poppins font for headings and Lora font for body text with automatic fallbacks
Apply accent colors (orange, blue, green) to shapes and non-text elements
Smart color selection based on background contrast
Preserve text hierarchy and formatting while applying brand styles
Maintain brand color fidelity using precise RGB values
limitations: Best results require Poppins and Lora fonts pre-installed in the environment
Falls back to Arial and Georgia if custom fonts are unavailable
Primarily designed for PowerPoint/presentation artifacts via python-pptx
Limited to Anthropic's specific brand guidelines only

use_cases.title: Corporate Presentation Styling
use_cases.description: Apply Anthropic's brand colors and typography to a PowerPoint presentation to ensure it matches corporate visual identity standards
use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams, sales representatives, or anyone creating client-facing presentations

use_cases.title: Document Branding
use_cases.description: Style reports, proposals, or documentation with Anthropic's official color scheme and font choices for a professional, cohesive look
use_cases.target_user: Content creators, technical writers, business analysts

use_cases.title: Design Consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure all visual artifacts created for Anthropic maintain consistent branding across teams and projects

prompt_templates.title: Apply Brand to Presentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic brand guidelines to this presentation, using the official colors and typography
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a PowerPoint file that needs to match Anthropic's visual identity

prompt_templates.title: Style with Brand Colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Anthropic's brand colors to style the shapes and text in this artifact
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating new visual content that should use Anthropic's color palette

prompt_templates.title: Format with Brand Typography
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's typography guidelines (Poppins for headings, Lora for body) to this document
prompt_templates.scenario: When formatting text content to match Anthropic's brand standards

output_examples.input: A PowerPoint presentation with default fonts and colors
output_examples.output: The same presentation with headings in Poppins font, body text in Lora, dark backgrounds (#141413), light text (#faf9f5), and accent shapes in orange (#d97757), blue (#6a9bcc), and green (#788c5d)

best_practices: Install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment before using this skill for optimal results
Use this skill on presentations and documents intended for external or official communication
Apply the skill after content creation to avoid disrupting your workflow
Verify font rendering if working across different operating systems
Combine with other design skills for comprehensive visual enhancement
anti_patterns: Don't rely on this skill for non-Anthropic branding projects
Avoid using without checking if custom fonts are available in your environment
Don't apply to informal internal documents where strict branding isn't necessary
Don't modify the brand color values - they are official standards

faq.question: What happens if I don't have Poppins or Lora fonts installed?
faq.answer: The skill automatically falls back to Arial for headings and Georgia for body text, maintaining readability across all systems.

faq.question: What file formats does this skill work with?
faq.answer: This skill is primarily designed for PowerPoint presentations using the python-pptx library, but the color and typography guidelines can be referenced for other formats.

faq.question: Can I customize the brand colors?
faq.answer: No, the colors are Anthropic's official brand colors and should not be modified to maintain brand consistency.

faq.question: How does the skill choose between accent colors?
faq.answer: For non-text shapes, the skill cycles through the three accent colors (orange, blue, green) to maintain visual interest while staying on-brand.

permissions: File read/write access for modifying artifacts
